p: Some reasoning on the findings can be considered. The frequency of stings, and thus of subsequent allergic reactions, is dependent on geographic, environmental, and ecological factors [ 53]. As mentioned in the introduction, the Vespa velutina is an IAS first detected in the Iberian Peninsula in 2010 and its spread throughout Spain has been very rapid. Since its arrival in Spain, the species has subsequently expanded its range and was detected in the communities of Aragón, Asturias, Balearic Islands, Cantabria, Castilla y León, Castilla-La Mancha, Cataluña, Extremadura, Galicia, País Vasco, Navarra, and La Rioja.
